headline: United Steelworkers union sets proposals for next refinery worker contract
summary: HOUSTON (Reuters) -More than 300 United Steelworkers union (USW) refinery and chemical plants workers meeting in Pittsburgh approved on Thursday proposals for labor negotiations set to begin early in 2026 with energy companies, said Mike Smith, chair of national oil bargaining for the union.  USW negotiators led by Smith and including International President David McCall and International Vice President Roxanne Brown will begin meeting in January with negotiators from Marathon Petroleum, which will be representing the industry.

headline: Oil Traders Race Against Time to Solve a Global Diesel Crunch
summary: (Bloomberg) -- The oil market is pulling all the levers it can to ease a global diesel crunch, but the window is narrowing to replenish stockpiles of the world’s workhorse fuel before hurricanes and refinery maintenance curtail output.
